problem: If $2010a + 2014b = 2018$ and $2012a + 2016b = 2020$, what is the value of $a - b$ ?
solution:
Subtracting the two equations gives: \begin{align*}
(2012a + 2016b)-(2010a + 2014b) &= 2020-2018\\
2a+2b &= 2\\
a+b &= 1
\end{align*}Multiplying this equation by 2010 and subtracting the resulting equation from $ 2010a + 2014b=2018$ gives \begin{align*}
4b &= (2010a + 2014b) - 2010(a+b)
\\\Rightarrow \qquad 4b &= 2018-2010
\\\Rightarrow \qquad 4b &= 8
\\\Rightarrow \qquad b &=2.
\end{align*}So $a-b = (a+b) - 2b = 1-4 = \boxed{-3}$.
model_solution:
Subtract the first equation from the second equation.
$2$
$$(2012a + 2016b) - (2010a + 2014b) = 2020 - 2018$$
$$(2012a + 2016b) - (2010a + 2014b) = 2020 - 2018$$
$$2a+2b=2$$
Divide both sides of the equation by 2.
$$a+b=1$$
Multiply the equation $a + b = 1$ by 2014 and subtract the equation $2010a + 2014b = 2018$ from the result.
$$2014(a+b) = 2014(1)$$
$$2014a+2014b=2014$$
$$(2014a+2014b)-(2010a+2014b)=2014-2018$$
$$(2014a+2014b)-(2010a+2014b)=2014-2018$$
$$(2014a+2014b)-(2010a+2014b)=2014-2018$$
$$4a=2014-2018$$
$$4a=-4$$
$$a=-1$$
Substitute a = -1 into the equation a + b = 1.
Substitute a = -1 into the equation a + b = 1: 
$$-1+b=1$$
$b=2$
Substitute $a=-1$ and $b=2$ into the expression $a-b$.

full_steps: Subtract the first equation from the second equation.

Divide both sides of the equation by 2.
$$a+b=1$$

Multiply the equation $a + b = 1$ by 2014 and subtract the equation $2010a + 2014b = 2018$ from the result.
$$2014(a+b) = 2014(1)$$
$$2014a+2014b=2014$$
$$(2014a+2014b)-(2010a+2014b)=2014-2018$$
Substitute a = -1 into the equation a + b = 1.

Substitute a = -1 into the equation a + b = 1: 
$$-1+b=1$$
